p: In general, if compared to the Céspedes et al. [ 66] assays with 177 and 178, 164 showed a better inhibition profile. Concentration-dependent, 164 inhibited respiration, germination, shoot and root elongation, and dry weight of the tested species, especially monocot species. It is worth pointing out that L. multiflorum was shown to be the most susceptible to this compound, with GI 50 120.6 μM, and causing 100% germination inhibition at 300 μM.
